results.title: Destiny of a man = Sudba cheloveka
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Melancholy and sympathetic view of the tragedies suffered by a family man and WW2 POW survivor. Haunted by his experiences in a concentration camp the man has survived this appalling event by clinging to the hope of reuniting with his wife and child. Directed by, and also starring Sergei Bondarchuk, this was a successful film that with its unstinting humanism, proved the ability of Russian filmmakers to combine cinematic beauty with compassionate sentiment.

results.title: The Star = Zvezda
results.creator_credit: Nikolai Lebedev, Karen Shakhnazarov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Based on the book by Emmanuil Kazakevich, this film focuses on a group of Russian scouts in WW2, aiming to penetrate Nazi communications and thwart a major attack. Echoing the themes of Steven Spielberg’s “Saving Private Ryan” (2000), director Nikolai Lebedev presents war as chaotic, taxing and disorienting. At times quite claustrophobic, the film works best when presenting the dangerously fraught reconnaissance missions undertaken by the unit.

results.title: Torpedo bombers = Torpedonostsy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
By interspersing historical footage with fictional narrative, this film attempts to present the precarious fighting conditions for WW2 Russian bomber pilots. The filmmaker ably captures the taxing environment in which battles were conducted and the constant danger to those serving in the armed forces. It also depicts the fraught personal lives of the pilots, under strain from wartime conditions. Based on the stories by Yuri German.

results.title: A Little night music
results.creator_credit: Harold Prince, Elliott Kastner, S&T-Film Berlin and Sascha Wein Film
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy musical adapted from the Broadway stage play by Harold Prince and Stephen Sondheim, set in Vienna at the turn of the century. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Diana Rigg, Len Cariou, Lesley-Ann Down, Hermione Gingold, Laurence Guittard. Features the well-known song “Send in the Clowns”. Screenplay by Hugh Wheeler.

results.title: Operation dumbo drop
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, David Madden, Diane Nabatoff and Interscope communications
results.brief_description: A jumbo-sized hit comedy. A seasoned army captain is teamed with a hard-nosed officer to conduct the “biggest” military manoeuvre ever - to secretly transport a full-grown elephant to a remote and nearly inaccessible jungle village. By land, sea and air, calamity and chaos prevail upon their hilariously mismatched team of would-be heroes. But with a little luck…and tons of hard work…they learn that no mission is impossible. Cast includes Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary.

results.title: Love laughs at Andy Hardy
results.creator_credit: Willis Goldbeck, Robert Sisk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This post-WWII film of the Hardy family reflects the true-life situation of Mickey Rooney as he plays G.I. Andy Hardy returning from his tour of duty at the war. The Hardy family represents the “typcial” stereotype American family with Andy a typical American teenager, interested in cars and girls, his stern but understanding father Judge James Hardy (Lewis Stone) and his dear loving mother Mrs Hardy (Fay Holden). When Andy finds himself falling for the lovely college co-ed Kay Wilson (Bonita Granville), little does he realise what disappointments lay ahead. Delightful, light-hearted romantic comedy based on the characters created by Aurania Rouverol. Cast also includes Sara Haden, Lina Romay and Dorothy Ford.

results.title: Palooka
results.creator_credit: Benjamin Stoloff, Edward Small, Edward Small Productions and Reliance Pictures
results.brief_description: Raw comedy drama based on Ham Fisher’s famous comic strip. Jimmy Durante plays the sometimes obnoxious and sleazy boxing manager Knobby Walsh as he goes about trying to exploit his up and coming protogee, the young and naive Joe Palooka (Stuart Erwin) to figh tthe current champion, Al McSwatt (played by James Cagney’s look alike brother, William Cagney). Also stars Lupe Velez, Marjorie Rambeau, Robert Armstrong and Mary Carlisle.

results.title: Headin' for Broadway
results.creator_credit: Joseph Brooks and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The lives of four young ambitious would-be Broadway performers is portrayed through the eyes of a documentary filmmaker. Fast Eddie (Rex Smith), Carrie Richards (Terri Treas), Valerie Walker (Vivian Reed) and Ralph Morelli (Paul Caratotes) although coming from very different backgrounds, all share the same aspirations and passion to make it on Broadway. In similar tradition to “Fame” this film is predominantly a music and dance scenario typical of the late 1970s and early 1980s, and features music and lyrics by awarding-winning composer Joseph Brooks.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Gene Kelly
results.creator_credit: Don Mischer, George Stevens and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that shaped the face of Hollywood. The charming and enchanting Gene Kelly is honoured in this tribute hosted by Shirley Maclaine. Through many film excerpts of his cinematic career, including For Me and My Gal (1942), An American in Paris (1951), Take Me Out to the Ballgame (1949), Cover Girl (1944), Singin’ in the Rain (1952) we see the wonderful genius and style of this multi-talented dancer, director, actor, and choreographer. Take a walk down memory lane as a number of Hollywood stars including Fred Astaire, James Stewart, Debbie Reynolds, Donald O’Connor, Cyd Charisse, Mikhail Baryshnikov, Leslie Caron and Olivia Newton-John celebrate Gene Kelly’s accomplishments with their own personal stories and reminiscings.

results.title: Lilacs in the spring
results.brief_description: Based upon the stage production of Robert Nesbitt’s “The Glorious days” by Harold Purcell with original music by Harry Parr Davies. This is a song and dance romantic comedy set in London during WWII starring the ever-charming somewhat older Errol Flynn, along with Anna Neagle, David Farrar, Kathleen Harrison, Peter Graves and Helen Haye.
